entry.title: Apollo Theater (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at New York City's Apollo Theater (pictured), amateurs could be swept off the stage?

entry.title: cataract surgery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that indirect evidence suggests that cataract surgery could have been performed as early as in ancient Egypt?

entry.title: a video game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the militant group Hezbollah released a video game in 2003?

entry.title: Profira Sadoveanu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that writer Profira Sadoveanu and her novelist father Mihail once had to take turns defending their home against attacks by the Iron Guard?

entry.title: U.S. Bank Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the U.S. Bank Center in Seattle once had a Montessori school on the 23rd floor?

entry.title: Benjamin Moloise's execution (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Benjamin Moloise's execution, the extremist group Direct Action bombed two Paris companies linked to South Africa in protest?

entry.title: John Brown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "John Brown" was recorded by Bob Dylan under the pseudonym "Blind Boy Grunt"?

entry.title: El Ojo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that El Ojo is a circular rotating floating island?
